To the moste renomed Prynce Lorde Sigismund myghtie Kyng of Poole, greate Duke of Luten and Russia, Lorde and heyre of all Prussia, Masouia, Samogitia &c. div.head: THE TRANSLATOVRE vpon the holy wryter Hosius.

lg.l: Semely Susanna was iudged to dye
By peruerse iudges which dyd her oppresse:
But godly Daniel her cause true dyd trye,
when contrary thynges he herd them confesse.
So sorrowfull Susan he dyd ryghtly redresse:
Her which seêmd synfull he proued to be sounde,
And them which seêmd godly, full gylty he founde.
Euen so holy Hosius in oure dolefull dayes
Seing the truthe to be troden with myght
Of misshapt Ministers, which with wyly wayes
Laboure to rob the truthe of her ryght,
Ragyng and rayling and spyttyng theire spyte,
One at an other, full farre from consent,
Here tryeth the truth against which thei be bent.
The truthe being tryde, the truthe let vs holde,
Praying to God to gyue vs hys grace,
To hate all heretykes, so blynde and so bolde,
which vnder fayr visardes do hide their fowle face,
And pray we deuoutly for our noble Quenes grace,
That the spryng of heresies to her being knowen,
She may roote vp the sedes which Sathā hath sowē.
